sentences.sContent: At age 43 she became abbess of her community.
sentences.sContent_eng: At age 43 she became abbess of her community.
sentences.sCn: 43岁时她成为当地的女修道院院长。

sentences.sContent: Once upon a time, there was an abbess in a small abbey .
sentences.sContent_eng: Once upon a time, there was an abbess in a small abbey .
sentences.sCn: 很久以前，一个小修道院里有一个女修道院院长。

sentences.sContent: Now the abbess is making her case for a religious life removed from worldly distractions-on the internet's world wide web.
sentences.sContent_eng: Now the abbess is making her case for a religious life removed from worldly distractions-on the internet's world wide web.
sentences.sCn: 如今，这位女修道院院长正在国际互联网路上的“全球网”超级档上为超凡拔俗的宗教生活阐明自己的立场。

synos.tran: 女修道院院长；女庵主持

remMethod.val: 来自abb(ey) (n. 修道士) + ess (女性) → 出色的女修道士 → 女修道院院长

words.tran: 大修道院，大寺院；修道院中全体修士或修女
神父，僧侣；男修道院院长

trans.tranCn: 女修道院院长， 尼姑庵住持
trans.tranOther: a woman who is in charge of a  convent (=  a place where a group of  nun s  live  )
